item.title: Matresses and chair fly tipped on pavement, 15th December
item.description:
Flytipping occurs here most weeks - now it is matresses and a chair. This spot needs a proper deterrant , the sign on wall diesn't stop it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Wingmore Road, Loughborough Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow on Plaistow lane, 15th December
item.description:
Can the double yellow lines be updated so more visible and also extended on the left hand side by the sports club? Allowing cars to park both sides by the roadabout causes a bottle neck. If its restricted on one side only, traffic would flow much more freely and cars wouldn't potentially get damaged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing litter bin on sw corner of Navarino Road at intersection with Dalston Lalne, 15th December
item.description:
There needs to be a litter bin here. Litter will be dumped here if it's not replaced, and has already started to be. Please return a litter bit to this spot, as it is filled every week, showing that this is an important spot for one.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large cardboard left next to private wheelie bins, 15th December
item.description:
A large cardboard box has been left next to our private wheelie bins outside 1 Marshalls Grove and has been there for approximately 2â€“3 days. This is not our waste and has been left outside the bin, which obstructs the bin area and risks refused collection. This has happened more than once. The bins are clearly marked with our house number.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Marshalls Grove, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 32 and 36 Woodsome Rd, 15th December
item.description:
Report 8009178 relating to this tree has been closed without addressing our concerns about the tree - detailed in the above report number. The tree has been pollarded recently but this does not address the numerous issues with this tree. Particularly concerning is the fungus growing on the tree and the potential health risk it poses to my young children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodsome Road, Dartmouth Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped vacuum cleaner, 15th December
item.description:
Someone keeps dumping stuff by our fence on the pavement it is not our waste Dumped vacuum cleaner and metal pipes and garden waste in a black bag not removed by bin service

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allen Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in front of Hackney Downs station, 15th December
item.description:
On either side of a redundant phone booth in front of Hackney Downs station a piece of carpet and a blanket have been dumped and are just staying there. I mentioned it to a staff member, but they weren't picked up, so I guess it's down to the Council...
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish between the trees, 15th December
item.description:
Rubbish/litter between the trees (papers, plastic, etc). The park is usually nicely cleaned every morning, but not between the trees, probably not visible for the collector. I can see it from my balcony.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 366-376, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discharge of mud and cement into gutter/drain, 15th December
item.description:
Builders at no 24 regularly sweep mud and today cement down into the gutter which is now flowing into the gulley- daily occurence now with digging under the house. Gulley will become blocked when mud and cement settle

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mount Pleasant Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
